title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Mathematics Learning Optimization Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental mathematical concepts and data analysis experience in work environments
context.additional_context: A course for corporate leaders/managers to enhance math-based decision-making skills, utilizing asynchronous learning environments with digital devices (tablets/laptops)

learning_goals: Learners can measure their cognitive load with 80% accuracy using the NASA-TLX scale in one-hour mathematics learning content
Learners identify differences in cognitive load between two learning conditions (text vs. visualization) with over 70% accuracy using the Workload Profile tool
Learners can self-assess their mental effort levels for each learning session using the 5-point RSME scale at least three times.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
